perturbation.original_text:
(g) The Blockchain Administrator is hereby authorized to enter into agreements with other service providers pursuant to which the
Blockchain Administrator may obtain the services of the service providers in fulfilling its responsibilities hereunder. The Blockchain Administrator
shall ensure that any such service provider shall operate in conformity with the requirements of the Investment Company Act and other applicable
federal and state law and shall maintain books and records of the Fund (if any) in a manner substantially similar to Section 2 of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
(g) The Blockchain Administrator is hereby authorized to enter into agreements with other service providers pursuant to which the
Blockchain Administrator may obtain the services of the service providers in fulfilling its responsibilities hereunder. The Blockchain Administrator
will use its best efforts to ensure that any such service provider operates in general conformity with the requirements of the Investment Company Act and other applicable
federal and state law and will attempt to maintain books and records of the Fund.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the Blockchain Administrator 'shall ensure' conformity with laws. The modified text weakens this to 'will use its best efforts to ensure' and 'operates in general conformity,' making compliance less stringent and more subjective. Furthermore, replacing 'shall maintain' with 'will attempt to maintain' introduces ambiguity regarding the responsibility to maintain books and records.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Investment Company Act of 1940, particularly sections related to record keeping (Rule 31a-1 and 31a-2) and oversight of service providers.
